library.name: Seed Library
library.description: Initial collection of 20 public domain books

books.title: Pride and Prejudice
books.author: Jane Austen
books.description: Elizabeth Bennet navigates society, family pressures, and her complicated feelings for the proud Mr. Darcy in Regency England.

books.title: Moby-Dick; Or, The Whale
books.author: Herman Melville
books.description: Sailor Ishmael narrates Captain Ahab's obsessive quest to hunt down Moby Dick, a giant white sperm whale.

books.title: Frankenstein
books.author: Mary Shelley
books.description: A young scientist creates a living creature from dead body parts, leading to tragic consequences for both creator and creation.

books.title: Dracula
books.author: Bram Stoker
books.description: Count Dracula travels from Transylvania to England, and a group led by Professor Van Helsing must stop his reign of terror.

books.title: The Adventures of Sherlock Holmes
books.author: Arthur Conan Doyle
books.description: Twelve short stories featuring the brilliant detective Sherlock Holmes and his companion Dr. Watson solving mysteries in Victorian London.

books.title: Alice's Adventures in Wonderland
books.author: Lewis Carroll
books.description: Young Alice falls down a rabbit hole into a fantastical world filled with peculiar creatures and nonsensical adventures.

books.title: The Great Gatsby
books.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
books.description: Nick Carraway narrates the story of mysterious millionaire Jay Gatsby and his obsession with the beautiful Daisy Buchanan in 1920s New York.

books.title: The Picture of Dorian Gray
books.author: Oscar Wilde
books.description: A young man wishes his portrait would age instead of himself, allowing him to pursue a life of pleasure while remaining eternally youthful.

books.title: A Tale of Two Cities
books.author: Charles Dickens
books.description: Set during the French Revolution, the novel follows characters in London and Paris whose lives become intertwined through love, sacrifice, and redemption.

books.title: Jane Eyre
books.author: Charlotte Bronte
books.description: An orphaned governess falls in love with her mysterious employer Mr. Rochester, but dark secrets threaten their happiness.

books.title: Wuthering Heights
books.author: Emily Bronte
books.description: A tale of passionate and destructive love between Heathcliff and Catherine on the Yorkshire moors, spanning two generations.

books.title: Crime and Punishment
books.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
books.description: A poor student in St. Petersburg commits murder and struggles with guilt and paranoia while a detective closes in.

books.title: The Adventures of Tom Sawyer
books.author: Mark Twain
books.description: A mischievous boy growing up along the Mississippi River gets into adventures involving treasure, pirates, and a murder mystery.

books.title: Adventures of Huckleberry Finn
books.author: Mark Twain
books.description: Huck Finn escapes his abusive father and travels down the Mississippi River with Jim, an escaped slave seeking freedom.

books.title: War and Peace
books.author: Leo Tolstoy
books.description: An epic novel following Russian aristocratic families during the Napoleonic Wars, exploring love, war, and the meaning of history.

books.title: The Count of Monte Cristo
books.author: Alexandre Dumas
books.description: Wrongfully imprisoned sailor Edmond Dantes escapes, discovers a vast treasure, and returns to Paris to exact revenge on those who betrayed him.

books.title: The Wonderful Wizard of Oz
books.author: L. Frank Baum
books.description: Dorothy and her dog Toto are swept from Kansas to Oz, where they join a Scarecrow, Tin Woodman, and Cowardly Lion on a journey to the Emerald City.

books.title: Treasure Island
books.author: Robert Louis Stevenson
books.description: Young Jim Hawkins discovers a pirate treasure map and embarks on a sea voyage filled with mutiny and adventure.

books.title: The Strange Case of Dr. Jekyll and Mr. Hyde
books.author: Robert Louis Stevenson
books.description: A London lawyer investigates the connection between the respectable Dr. Jekyll and the evil Mr. Hyde, uncovering a disturbing secret.

books.title: Little Women
books.author: Louisa May Alcott
books.description: Four sisters grow up during the Civil War era, facing hardships, romance, and personal growth as they transition into adulthood.
